comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Gilson Willets [photographer] (1869 - c.1922) was a pioneering photojournalist, war correspondent, and globe-trotting reporter for 25 years. He was also a prolific novelist.[1] He took many photographs of people, military camps, domestic life, home interiors, etc. in Cuba, Manila, and Puerto Rico at the time of the Spanish American War.[2]
